content: The reason Thunderbird may stop working with a VPN is the very same reason a VPN is used for, i.e. to hide your real IP address. If you appear to the mail servers as having an IP address they don't allow connections from, for example, that would prevent Thunderbird from being able to use those servers. Have you checked whether the same happens with a different mail client?
creator: DavidGG

content: Some VPNs have 'split tunnelling' options to allow specified apps to bypass the VPN, but if not, mail apps are blocked for the reasons stated above.

content: This may be a problem with updating prefs.js file. Any change made is immediately effective, but if thunderbird closes without updating prefs.js, then changes are lost.It might be that the file is in read-only state, or an antivirus program is interfering. A way to check is to look in windows file explorer at the profile to see the date that prefs.js was last updated. and sometimes there may be multiple copies of prefs.js, such as prefs-1.js, prefs-2.js, etc. If you see that, I suggest deleting all except the one with highest number and rename that to prefs.js. Do this while thunderbird is not running. Even if that works, the bigger question is what is interfering with updates. What I wrote here may not be the problem, but it definitely sounds like it.
creator: davidsk

content:
"How can I see which are the largest files in my inbox?"

The Size column can be displayed in Table View to show each message's size (right-click any column button to enable other columns). Right-click a folder, Properties, to see 'Size on disk'.

Messages with attachments are usually the largest, and attachments can be detached (saved then deleted) or deleted.
creator: sfhowes

content:
If you use 'Threads' and a thread is in a 'collapsed' state then clicking on that collapsed threads means open all threads therein in separate tabs - this has always been the means of opening up everything because you are clicking on an entire thread and not an individual mail in thread.

If you 'expand' the thread first then you can click on any email in that thread to display in either Mesasge Pane or in separate tab. It will only open the selected email.

The alternative to see all comments in a thread is to use a right click and select 'Open' > 'Open Message in conversion' and that opens one tab with all other threads listed both incoming and outgoing.

content:
Here goes: - first, click account settings and then synchronization&storage and click 'advanced' button to verify that the folders can be downloaded - then, click File>offline/download to ensure that all headers and messages of all folders are eligible for downloaded - now, install the addon, importexporttools NG. - now, highlight each folder separately, rightclick and select importexport option to download mbox - once finished, copy to USB

- if you need to read them later, you can revert the process as this: - highlight Local Folders - rightclick and select importexport option to import mbox. repeat for each folder

What you have is an IMAP account and can be verified by clicking account settings and checking top pane for the account which will state POP or IMAP. An IMAP account resides on the server, not the PC. That is why there are extra steps.
creator: davidsk

content:
Gabriela Rączka said
How can I unhook my email address from Thunderbird without deleting it normally? I have an account connected to GMAIL and I want to detach it only from Thunderbird

Account Settings, select the account, Account Actions (bottom of left pane), Remove account. This will remove it from TB, but not affect it on any other device or app. The Default account cannot be removed, so set another account as default before removing the gmail account.
creator: sfhowes
